StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: MYB-QKI rearrangements in Angiocentric Glioma drive tumorigenicity through a tripartite mechanism

Person.Organization: DANA-FARBER CANCER INSTBRIGHAM AND WOMEN'S HOSPITAL

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: We would like to thank and acknowledge the members of ‘A Kids’ Brain Tumor Cure Pediatric Low-Grade Astrocytoma Foundation’ (http://akidsbraintumorcure.org) for their support of PLGG dedicated research, members of the ‘Children's Brain Tumor Tissue Consortium’ (www.cbttc.org) for their support of open access, biospecimen driven research, members of the Firehose Team at the Broad Institute for their assistance with genomic analysis, the Neuro-Histology labs of Boston Children’s Hospital and Brigham and Women’s Hospital for their help and support, and Heather Homer (Brigham and Women's Hospital Department of Pathology, Center for Advanced Molecular Diagnostics, Division of Cytogenetics) for her technical assistance with FISH. We would like to thank members of the Ligon, Resnick and Beroukhim laboratories for their useful discussions. Finally we would like to thank and acknowledge the many children and families affected by PLGGs for their generous contributions to this research. Funding Sources: A Kids’ Brain Tumor Cure Foundation Pediatric Low-Grade Astrocytoma Foundation (PB, KLL, RB, MWK, LG, CS, ACR), R01NS085336 (ACR, AJW, PBS, MS), Voices Against Brain Cancer (ACR), Children's Brain Tumor Foundation (ACR, AJW), Stop and Shop Pediatric Brain Tumor Program (PB, MWK), Path to Cure Foundation (KLL), NIH PO1CA142536 (CS, KLL, RB), St Baldrick’s Foundation (PB), American Brain Tumor Association (LR), Team Jack Foundation (PB, MWK, RB, LG), Andrysiak Fund for LGG (MWK), Jared Branfman Sunflowers For Life Fund For Pediatric Brain And Spinal Cancer Research (PB, RB, SS), Sontag Foundation (KLL, RB), Nuovo-Soldati Foundation(GB), Philippe Foundation(GB), Fondation Etoile de Martin (JG), Damon Runyon-Sohn Pediatric Fellowship Award (AJW), Hyundai Scholar Grant (AJW), Bear Necessities Pediatric Cancer Foundation (AJW, ACR) Rally Foundation for Childhood Cancer Research (AJW), K08NS087118 (SHR), Pediatric Brain Tumor Foundation (RB, PB), Thea’s Star of Hope (ACR, AJW).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Nervous Tissue Tumors)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-NTT
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Nervous Tissue Tumors.
